004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj;
006
007import static edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.util.ErrorMessages.requireNonNullParam;
008
009import edu.wpi.first.hal.FRCNetComm.tResourceType;
010import edu.wpi.first.hal.HAL;
011import edu.wpi.first.networktables.EntryListenerFlags;
012import edu.wpi.first.networktables.NetworkTable;
013import edu.wpi.first.networktables.NetworkTableEntry;
014import edu.wpi.first.networktables.NetworkTableInstance;
015import java.util.Collection;
016
017/**
018 * The preferences class provides a relatively simple way to save important values to the roboRIO to
019 * access the next time the roboRIO is booted.
020 *
021 * <p>This class loads and saves from a file inside the roboRIO. The user can not access the file
022 * directly, but may modify values at specific fields which will then be automatically saved to the
023 * file by the NetworkTables server.
024 *
025 * <p>This class is thread safe.
026 *
027 * <p>This will also interact with {@link NetworkTable} by creating a table called "Preferences"
028 * with all the key-value pairs.
029 */
030public final class Preferences {
031  /** The Preferences table name. */
032  private static final String TABLE_NAME = "Preferences";
033  /** The network table. */
034  private static final NetworkTable m_table;
035
036  /** Creates a preference class. */
037  private Preferences() {}
038
039  static {
040    m_table = NetworkTableInstance.getDefault().getTable(TABLE_NAME);
041    m_table.getEntry(".type").setString("RobotPreferences");
042    // Listener to set all Preferences values to persistent
043    // (for backwards compatibility with old dashboards).
044    m_table.addEntryListener(
045        (table, key, entry, value, flags) -> entry.setPersistent(),
046        EntryListenerFlags.kImmediate | EntryListenerFlags.kNew);
047    HAL.report(tResourceType.kResourceType_Preferences, 0);
048  }
049
050  /**
051   * Gets the preferences keys.
052   *
053   * @return a collection of the keys
054   */
055  public static Collection<String> getKeys() {
056    return m_table.getKeys();
057  }
058
059  /**
060   * Puts the given string into the preferences table.
061   *
062   * @param key the key
063   * @param value the value
064   * @throws NullPointerException if value is null
065   */
066  public static void setString(String key, String value) {
067    requireNonNullParam(value, "value", "setString");
068
069    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
070    entry.setString(value);
071    entry.setPersistent();
072  }
073
074  /**
075   * Puts the given string into the preferences table if it doesn't already exist.
076   *
077   * @param key The key
078   * @param value The value
079   */
080  public static void initString(String key, String value) {
081    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
082    entry.setDefaultString(value);
083    entry.setPersistent();
084  }
085
086  /**
087   * Puts the given int into the preferences table.
088   *
089   * @param key the key
090   * @param value the value
091   */
092  public static void setInt(String key, int value) {
093    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
094    entry.setDouble(value);
095    entry.setPersistent();
096  }
097
098  /**
099   * Puts the given int into the preferences table if it doesn't already exist.
100   *
101   * @param key The key
102   * @param value The value
103   */
104  public static void initInt(String key, int value) {
105    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
106    entry.setDefaultDouble(value);
107    entry.setPersistent();
108  }
109
110  /**
111   * Puts the given double into the preferences table.
112   *
113   * @param key the key
114   * @param value the value
115   */
116  public static void setDouble(String key, double value) {
117    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
118    entry.setDouble(value);
119    entry.setPersistent();
120  }
121
122  /**
123   * Puts the given double into the preferences table if it doesn't already exist.
124   *
125   * @param key The key
126   * @param value The value
127   */
128  public static void initDouble(String key, double value) {
129    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
130    entry.setDefaultDouble(value);
131    entry.setPersistent();
132  }
133
134  /**
135   * Puts the given float into the preferences table.
136   *
137   * @param key the key
138   * @param value the value
139   */
140  public static void setFloat(String key, float value) {
141    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
142    entry.setDouble(value);
143    entry.setPersistent();
144  }
145
146  /**
147   * Puts the given float into the preferences table if it doesn't already exist.
148   *
149   * @param key The key
150   * @param value The value
151   */
152  public static void initFloat(String key, float value) {
153    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
154    entry.setDefaultDouble(value);
155    entry.setPersistent();
156  }
157
158  /**
159   * Puts the given boolean into the preferences table.
160   *
161   * @param key the key
162   * @param value the value
163   */
164  public static void setBoolean(String key, boolean value) {
165    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
166    entry.setBoolean(value);
167    entry.setPersistent();
168  }
169
170  /**
171   * Puts the given boolean into the preferences table if it doesn't already exist.
172   *
173   * @param key The key
174   * @param value The value
175   */
176  public static void initBoolean(String key, boolean value) {
177    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
178    entry.setDefaultBoolean(value);
179    entry.setPersistent();
180  }
181
182  /**
183   * Puts the given long into the preferences table.
184   *
185   * @param key the key
186   * @param value the value
187   */
188  public static void setLong(String key, long value) {
189    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
190    entry.setDouble(value);
191    entry.setPersistent();
192  }
193
194  /**
195   * Puts the given long into the preferences table if it doesn't already exist.
196   *
197   * @param key The key
198   * @param value The value
199   */
200  public static void initLong(String key, long value) {
201    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
202    entry.setDefaultDouble(value);
203    entry.setPersistent();
204  }
205
206  /**
207   * Returns whether or not there is a key with the given name.
208   *
209   * @param key the key
210   * @return if there is a value at the given key
211   */
212  public static boolean containsKey(String key) {
213    return m_table.containsKey(key);
214  }
215
216  /**
217   * Remove a preference.
218   *
219   * @param key the key
220   */
221  public static void remove(String key) {
222    m_table.delete(key);
223  }
224
225  /** Remove all preferences. */
226  public static void removeAll() {
227    for (String key : m_table.getKeys()) {
228      if (!".type".equals(key)) {
229        remove(key);
230      }
231    }
232  }
233
234  /**
235   * Returns the string at the given key. If this table does not have a value for that position,
236   * then the given backup value will be returned.
237   *
238   * @param key the key
239   * @param backup the value to return if none exists in the table
240   * @return either the value in the table, or the backup
241   */
242  public static String getString(String key, String backup) {
243    return m_table.getEntry(key).getString(backup);
244  }
245
246  /**
247   * Returns the int at the given key. If this table does not have a value for that position, then
248   * the given backup value will be returned.
249   *
250   * @param key the key
251   * @param backup the value to return if none exists in the table
252   * @return either the value in the table, or the backup
253   */
254  public static int getInt(String key, int backup) {
255    return (int) m_table.getEntry(key).getDouble(backup);
256  }
257
258  /**
259   * Returns the double at the given key. If this table does not have a value for that position,
260   * then the given backup value will be returned.
261   *
262   * @param key the key
263   * @param backup the value to return if none exists in the table
264   * @return either the value in the table, or the backup
265   */
266  public static double getDouble(String key, double backup) {
267    return m_table.getEntry(key).getDouble(backup);
268  }
269
270  /**
271   * Returns the boolean at the given key. If this table does not have a value for that position,
272   * then the given backup value will be returned.
273   *
274   * @param key the key
275   * @param backup the value to return if none exists in the table
276   * @return either the value in the table, or the backup
277   */
278  public static boolean getBoolean(String key, boolean backup) {
279    return m_table.getEntry(key).getBoolean(backup);
280  }
281
282  /**
283   * Returns the float at the given key. If this table does not have a value for that position, then
284   * the given backup value will be returned.
285   *
286   * @param key the key
287   * @param backup the value to return if none exists in the table
288   * @return either the value in the table, or the backup
289   */
290  public static float getFloat(String key, float backup) {
291    return (float) m_table.getEntry(key).getDouble(backup);
292  }
293
294  /**
295   * Returns the long at the given key. If this table does not have a value for that position, then
296   * the given backup value will be returned.
297   *
298   * @param key the key
299   * @param backup the value to return if none exists in the table
300   * @return either the value in the table, or the backup
301   */
302  public static long getLong(String key, long backup) {
303    return (long) m_table.getEntry(key).getDouble(backup);
304  }
305}
